fields_of_interest: Trade, International co-operation and development, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Transport
eu_initiatives: The Platform is advocating for European legislation to regulate the ship recycling practices of European ship owners, and contributes strongly to the development of the EU Ship Recycling Regulation which was adopted in December 2013. Currently, the Platform focuses on the implementation of the EU SRR including the set-up of the EU list of compliant ship recycling facilities and the adoption of a financial incentive to strengthen enforcement. The Platform additionally monitors the enforcement of the EU Waste Shipment Regulation for end-of-life ships and the development of EU maritime policies.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: The NGO Shipbreaking Platform is a global coalition of human rights and environmantal organisations working to ensure safe and environmantally sound ship dismantling world wide. The Platform has a strong focus on the practices of European ship owners and is closely working with the European Institutions to ensure effective European legislation on the issue.
relevant_communication: The Platform publishes "Platform News" and "Breaking News" on legislative and policy developments as well as the practices of European shipping companies. The "South Asia Quarterly Update" informs specifically about European ship owners' that sell their vessels for dirty and dangerous scrapping on tidal beaches. A blog on ship owners' practices at www.offthebeach.org additionally informs of industry worst and best practice. Events and debates with European policy makers and industry stakeholders on the implementation of the EU Ship Recycling Regulation will be organised in 2017.
